intro: Schenckia, commonly known as the common tansy, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and yellow-orange flower heads that contain numerous small florets. Schenckia is often found in meadows and along roadsides, thriving in well-drained soils. It is also known for its aromatic properties and has been used historically in herbal medicine.
